intro: Chirita vestita, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Chirita vestita is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
